## What is public AI?
Public AI is**AI as public infrastructure**: provisioned like electricity, water, roads, libraries, or the Internet itself.
* Public AI is**publicly accessible**: ensuring AI delivers benefits to all.

results.title: SABER: A new way to operationally assess AI-enabled battlefield systems
results.snippet: AI shows great promise in transforming military decision-making by improving speed and accuracy. But are AI-enabled systems resilient against adversarial threats? From data poisoning to model-stealing attacks, the risks are real, and operational security gaps remain.\n\nEnter Securing AI for Battlefield Effective Robustness (SABER), our new program aimed at building an AI red team capable of testing and securing battlefield AI systems. SABER will focus on ground and aerial systems, developing cu

## [About](https://embeddedaipodcast.com/about/)

## About the Podcast

Welcome to the **Embedded AI Podcast** \- exploring AI in embedded systems with a pragmatic, no-hype approach.

We cover AI in embedded systems from two angles:

1. **AI on embedded devices** \- traditional ML, edge computing, predictive maintenance, IoT applications
2. **AI for embedded developers** \- using LLMs and AI tools effectively in your development workflow

This podcast is about learning together. We’ll share what

results.title: Deployed: The AI Product Podcast
results.snippet:
# Deployed: The AI Product Podcast

Freeplay

- 5.0 (8)
- [TECHNOLOGY](https://podcasts.apple.com/us/genre/1318?l=en-US)

Deployed is the podcast for people building AI products.
With all the hype about AI over the past two years, it’s often been hard to discern what’s actually working. We started Deployed to share the real-world stories of the leaders, engineers, product & design teams, and data teams who are building and running great generative AI products for their customers.
In each episode

# About

My name is Renée DiResta. I'm an Associate Research Professor at the [McCourt School of Public Policy at Georgetown](https://mccourt.georgetown.edu/?ref=reneediresta.com). Previously, I was the technical research manager at [Stanford Internet Observatory](https://cyber.fsi.stanford.edu/io/content/io-landing-page-2?ref=reneediresta.com), a cross-disciplinary program of research, teaching and policy engagement for the study of adversarial abuse in current information technologies.
